concise_definition: n. 碰撞, 撞击; v. 碰撞, 撞击; (非正式) 推搡, 挤压

definitions.explanation_en: A sudden, often accidental, collision or impact between two objects or people, typically producing a dull sound or minor damage.
definitions.explanation_cn: 两个物体或人之间突然的、通常是意外的碰撞或撞击，常伴随沉闷的声响或轻微损坏。
definitions.example_en: The car suffered a bump when it hit the curb.
definitions.example_cn: 汽车撞上路缘时受到了一次撞击。

definitions.explanation_en: To strike or collide with something, often unintentionally or with mild force, especially in a crowded or confined space.
definitions.explanation_cn: 无意中或以轻微力量撞击某物，尤其在拥挤或狭小的空间中。
definitions.example_en: I kept bumping into people in the crowded subway.
definitions.example_cn: 在拥挤的地铁里，我不断撞到人。

definitions.explanation_en: To move or progress in a slow, irregular, or jolting manner, often due to uneven terrain or poor conditions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因地形不平或条件恶劣而缓慢、不规则或颠簸地移动。
definitions.example_en: The old truck bumped along the dirt road.
definitions.example_cn: 那辆旧卡车颠簸着行驶在土路上。

definitions.explanation_en: A slight rise or protuberance on a surface, often caused by pressure or impact.
definitions.explanation_cn: 表面上因压力或撞击而形成的轻微隆起或凸起。
definitions.example_en: There was a bump on the table where the heavy vase had sat for years.
definitions.example_cn: 桌子上有块凸起，是那沉重的花瓶放了多年留下的痕迹。

definitions.explanation_en: (Informal) To push or shove someone, especially to make way or in a rough manner.
definitions.explanation_cn: (非正式) 推搡某人，尤指为了开路或粗暴地移动。
definitions.example_en: He was bumping people aside to get to the front of the line.
definitions.example_cn: 他推搡着人群，想挤到队伍前面。

comparison.analysis: “Collision” (碰撞) 更正式，强调两个物体以显著力量相撞，常用于交通事故或物理学术语，后果通常更严重。而 “bumping” 更轻、更随意，常指轻微、偶然的接触，不具破坏性。
“Jostling” (推挤) 通常指在人群中因拥挤而互相推搡，带有持续性和人际互动的意味，常用于描述排队或集会场景。而 “bumping” 可以是单次、无意识的接触，不一定涉及人际冲突。
“Knock” (敲击) 通常指有目的、有节奏或较清晰的撞击动作，如敲门、敲击物体。而 “bumping” 更强调无意识、笨拙或连续的碰撞，声音更沉闷，动作更不精确。
